reviews.text: This the second tme I havve stayed for one night at this hotel. On both occasions my request for a quiet room with a view were met by the hotel. On this visit breakfast was included in the price and was excellent. The room was spotless and the receptionist very helpful with directions, supplying me with a map. It is a 2 min walk from the bus station and Liverpool One shopping centre. Would happily return and would love to stay longer. Will definitely be back.
reviews.title: One night stay at the Novotel Hanover St, Liverpool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently enjoyed a seven night stay. The room was comfortable and quiet. The staff were attentive. There was a reasonable variety of good food on offer for breakfast. As mentioned by others, the location of this hotel vis-a-vis Liverpool city centre, the Albert Dock, etc. is very good. Parking was convenient next to the hotel.
reviews.title: Good location and comfortable

reviews.text: I visited this hotel from 31st August to 2nd September and stayed with my brother in a twin room. The experience was wholly positive and is very impressed with the way we were dealt with from check-in to check-out.
reviews.title: Super location and friendly staff
Brilliant hotel with a great location
reviews.text: The room was a good size, modern and clean and the bathroom was well appointed. Breakfast was very good with a good range of items from the traditional fry to yoghurts, cereals etc.

The location was really excellent. It is just metres away from the Liverpool One complex which in turn links up with the Cavern Walks, Albert Docks etc. The Rope Walks entertainment area is just around the corner also.
reviews.title: family friendly and good quality, two things you dont normally get together

reviews.text: Lovely clean spacious room and great breakfast. Hotel is in a great central location. Only annoyances were that the room was still not ready to check in at 3pm after going back twice to try and check in, and there was no key cards available for our room for the first few hours so in order to get into our own room the receptionist had to let us in and out, also a bit annoying. However, once we had our key cards everything else was great, pool was lovely and the beds were very comfy.
reviews.title: Lovely Night Stay

reviews.text: Just had a lovely two night stay at the novotel. Stayed in a family room which was really spacious and well laid out. Great breakfast with quality products and plenty of choice.
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.text: Staff helpful and attentive especially Jackie who couldn't do enough for us.
reviews.title: Highly Delighted!

reviews.text: Thankyou and we look forward to visiting again soon.
reviews.title: Exc eptional value, good location, lovely staff, poor breakfast and a dreadful price for Wifi

reviews.text: Booked a family room last minute via late rooms (breakfast included).- Room was very clean, both beds were very large. We were on the 7th floor, so experienced no noise and had 2 very good night sleeps. My teenage son enjoyed the pool and steam room. Breakfast was good quality and found we didn't have to wait too long if we ate just before 9.00am although they do serve breakfast until 10.00am. The location is ideal for the Albert Dock, Liverpool Museum and all The Beatles things, and Liverpool One shopping centre is just over the road and great for eating out. A 10 minute walk from Lime Street Station. All the staff seemed efficient and the reception staff were very helpful. Would use again.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would reccomend this hotel to anyone visiting Liverpool, and I would reccomend a visit to Liverpool to anyone visiting the U.K.
reviews.title: Good, comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in an Executive Room. These are spacious and well appointed rooms with many mod-cons: Nespresso machine, free WiFi and a very good shower. The staff at this hotel are really helpful in terms of general assistance, and little things that make a stay more comfortable, such as extra Nespresso pods and directions to restaurants.
reviews.title: Recommended

reviews.text: The room was spotless, and the whole hotel had a clean and well maintained air.
reviews.title: Nice option in the centre of Liverpool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking is not free, but it is discounted. It is quite close to the hotel and is above a Tesco supermarket which is helpful.
reviews.title: Good all round

reviews.text: We stayed at Novotel on August 30th for 1 night as we were attending the Liverpool vs Hearts game & redeeming a tour of Anfield voucher I got my boyfriend for Xmas. First impression was a lovely clean reception area. Checked in with no problems and headed up to our room ... We passed 2 cleaners in corridor on way into room ... And found the bed unmade and rubbish from the people in the room before us. We told the cleaners who were as surprised as we were and apologised. We went back down to reception who immediately gave us another room on a different floor. Wasn't a huge problem as we had allowed plenty of time before game, may have been if we were in a rush, but we were happy with how quickly it was fixed.
reviews.title: Great location, very good hotel.

reviews.text: Stayed in an Excecutive room we booked on Late Rooms which included breakfast for 2 for an extra £3.50! We were happy with room, bed comfy and shower nice. The hair dryer was powerful which makes a change in a hotel and helped make getting ready much quicker for me!
reviews.title: Novotel Liverpool - Some real issues

reviews.text: Great location for Liverpool One and we enjoyed a look round the shops before a quick swim. Nice pool and steam room.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, great value

reviews.text: I was aware of the comments about queuing for breakfast from other travellers and the hotel is also trying to solve this with a "traffic light system" to let you know when they are busiest (9-10). We headed down at 8.40 and although busy the staff were doing everything they could to ensure it ran quickly & smoothly, showing people to tables, cleaning them at speed, restocking food etc. I honestly don't think they could have done anymore. Food was great - we had cooked breakfast but lots of other choice as well.
reviews.title: Mathew Street Festival Liverpool

reviews.text: Check out was smooth, short queue as others checked out but dealt with well. We parked at the Q Park on John Lewis and despite what others have said, we still got £5 off from hotel which was a nice touch.
reviews.title: "Great place to stay"
